intro: Malesherbia thyrsoidea, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. It has simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. Malesherbia thyrsoidea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
